analysis: The documents in this cluster primarily concern actions taken under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933 and related legislation during the early and mid-1930s, along with some actions related to labor and wartime production in the early 1940s. They involve establishing codes of fair competition, setting standards for wages and working hours, and regulating exports for national defense. The sentiment is generally focused on economic recovery, industrial regulation, and mobilization for defense.
title: Industrial Regulation and Economic Recovery Era
